intro: Globimetula anguliflora, commonly known as the angular-flowered globemetula, is a unique species of flowering plant characterized by its distinctive angular floral structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in a globular inflorescence. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Globimetula anguliflora is native to specific regions in southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
